channel.description: Virtual Data Optimizer (VDO) Used for storage optimization Device driver layer that sits between the Linux kernel and the physical storage devices. Conserve disk space, improve data throughput, and save on storage cost. Employs thin provisioning, de-duplication, and compression technologies to help realize the goals. How VDO Conserves Storage Stage 1 Makes use of thin provisioning to identify and eliminate empty (zero-byte) data blocks. (zero-block elimination) Removes randomization of data blocks by moving in-use data blocks to contiguous locations on the storage device.
